text: The Wild Bunch is a 1969 American epic Western Technicolor and Panavision movie directed by Sam PeckinpahVariety film review; June 18, 1969, p. 6. about an aging outlaw gang on the Texasâ€“Mexico border, trying to exist in the changing modern world of 1913. The movie was controversial because of its graphic violence and its portrayal of crude men attempting to survive by any available means. The movie, whose screenplay was written by Peckinpah and Walon Green, stars William Holden, Robert Ryan, Ernest Borgnine, Ben Johnson, Alfonso Arau and Warren Oates. It was filmed in Mexico. ==References== Category:1969 movies Category:1960s Western (genre) movies Category:American epic movies Category:American Western (genre) movies Category:Movies set in the 1910s Category:Movies set in Mexico Category:Movies directed by Sam Peckinpah
title: The Wild Bunch
